bioghist.p: The College of Montana, Bozeman, Montana, was a Presbyterian college founded in 1882. It merged with Montana Wesleyan University in 1932 to form Intermountain Union College.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the trustees minutes, 1884-1913, which include summary financial reports, details of financial transactions, information on the employment of faculty, and resolutions regarding the move of the college from Deer Lodge to Great Falls, Montana, in 1913. The volume includes an extract from a college catalog giving the early history of the college.
